info.description: The Delta Sharing protocol is still very early in its development.
info.title: Delta Sharing Protocol

get.summary: List the shares accessible to the recipient
get.description:
Without any query parameters the request will return the first page
of "shares" available to the authenticated recipent

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to be returned in a single page. If
the number of potential results exceeds the number of maximum
results, the response will contain a `nextpageToken` which can be
used in subsequent requests.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Optionally provided page token for requesting a subsequent page of results

200.description: The user could successfully list the shares

get.summary: List the schemas in a share

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: Named share to list the schemas

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to be returned in a single page. If
the number of potential results exceeds the number of maximum
results, the response will contain a `nextpageToken` which can be
used in subsequent requests.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Optionally provided page token for requesting a subsequent page of results

200.description: The user could successfully list the schemas in the given share

404.description: The named share could not be found

/shares/{share}/schemas/{schema}/tables.summary: List the tables in a given share's schema

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: Named share for finding the named schema

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to be returned in a single page. If
the number of potential results exceeds the number of maximum
results, the response will contain a `nextpageToken` which can be
used in subsequent requests.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Optionally provided page token for requesting a subsequent page of results

200.description: The user could successfully list the tables for the given schema in the given share

404.description: The named share or schema could not be found

head.summary: Return the latest version identifier for the named table
head.description:
This is the API for clients to get a table version without any other
extra information. The server usually can implement this API
effectively. If a client caches information about a shared table
locally, it can store the table version and use this cheap API to
quickly check whether their cache is stale and they should re-fetch the
data.

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: Named share for finding the named schema

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Named schema for finding the named table

200.description: The table was found and has a versoin

Delta-Table-Version.description: A long value which represents the current table version

404.description: The named share, schema, or table could not be found

get.summary: Query the metadata and schema of the given table

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: Named share for finding the named schema

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Named schema for finding the named table

200.description:
A sequence of JSON strings containing the table protocol
and then the table metadata

headers.description: A long value which represents the current table version

404.description: The named share, schema, or table could not be found

parameters.name: share
parameters.description: Named share for finding the named schema

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: Named schema for finding the named table

200.description:
A sequence of JSON strings containing the table protocol, metadata,
and then a number of lines for each file in the table.

headers.description: A long value which represents the current table version

404.description: The named share, schema, or table could not be found

predicateHints.description:
A list of SQL-like boolean expressions using the restricted subset of
SQL passed in as a JSON array, one per expression

Each entry should be a single SQL-like boolean expression using:
  * `=`
  * `>`
  * `<`
  * `>=`
  * `<=`
  * `<>`
  * `IS NULL`
  * `IS NOT NULL`

limitHint.description:
Itâ€™s a hint from the client to tell the server how many rows the
client plans to read. The server can use this hint to return only
some files by using the stats in the Delta transaction logs. For
example, when running SELECT * FROM table LIMIT 1000, the client
can send limit=1000 to the server
